frame.name: Feigning
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> acts in such a way as to give the incorrect impression to observers that a particular <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> holds.
<ex><fex name="Agent">Jordan</fex> <t>feigned</t> <fex name="Original">a love of jazz music</fex> <fex name="Purpose">to get her phone number</fex> .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Agent
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person who acts in a misleading way to create the impression that a <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> holds.
<ex>A year after <fex name="agt">Audrey Seiler</fex> <t>faked</t> her own kidnapping while at college in Wisconsin, her lawyer says she's getting help and paying restitution.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Original
FE.definition: <def-root>This is the entity which is copied. With verbs it is frequently expressed as an NP Object: Pat <t>falsified</t> <fex name="Original">the papers</fex>. </def-root>

FE.name: Copy
FE.definition: <def-root>The Copy produced by the Creator most commonly occurs as the External Argument of a predicative use of an adjective or noun target: <fex name="Copy">The painting</fex> is a <t>fake</t>. </def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the intentional act which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an <fen>Agent</fen> that also affect the action (<ment>presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully</ment>).
</def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>An act performed by the <fen>Agent</fen> that accomplishes the imitation. <ex>I <t>feigned</t> death <fex name="Mns">by breaking a bag of pig's blood and falling to the floor</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: State_of_affairs
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> is a an event, a state, or a property that the <fen>Agent</fen> wants others to believe have occurred or hold.
<ex>A college student who <t>staged</t> <fex name="State_of_affairs">her own disappearance</fex> last month will try to reach a plea agreement and avoid trial on charges she obstructed officers.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>An action or state that the <fen>Agent</fen> intends to accomplish by performing the feigning of some <fen>State_of_affairs</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> denotes a proposition from which the feigning event logically follows. </def-root>

FE.name: Frequency
FE.definition: <def-root>How often the <fen>Agent</fen> engages in the Feigning event. </def-root>

FE.name: Period_of_iterations
FE.definition: <def-root>The length of time from when the event denoted by the target began to be repeated to when it stopped.</def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition: <def-root>The amount of time that the <fen>Agent</fen> feigns something.</def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE describes a participant of the state of affairs as being in some state during the feigning action. </def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. </def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>The place in which the <fen>Agent</fen> feigns something.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: feign.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: pretend to be affected by.

lexUnit.name: affect.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: pretend to have a property or be in a particular state

lexUnit.name: pretend.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: act so as to make it appear that something is the case when in fact it is not.
